sources.title: "The Mountaineer's Honor" (1909) director D. W. Griffith, cinematographer Billy Bitzer
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     "The Mountaineer's Honor" is a short drama directed by D. W. Griffith. This film illustrates the work of Arthur V. Johnson and Billy Bitzer, stars of Silent Hall of Fame. A valley visitor deceives and then abandons a mountain girl. Her brother's honor is hurt and he leaves in pursuit of justice. Directed by                          D.W. Griffith Produced by                        Biograph Company Scenario by                          D.W. Griffith, Frank E. Woods Cinematography                G.W. Bitzer Starring                                Mary Pickford, Arthur V. Johnson, James Kirkwood, Owen Moore, Kate Bruce Distributed by                     Biograph Company Release date                         November, 1909 Running time                       11 min. metadata.Plot: A mountain girl is seduced by a traveler from the valley. Her brother tracks the seducer down and kills him. In retaliation, the sheriff captures the brother and prepares to lynch him. Mother intervenes and, to save her son the disgrace of hanging, shoots him.
metadata.Actors: Mary Pickford, Owen Moore, James Kirkwood
